result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan J Shaughnessy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Judgment AMENDED to remove $200 DNA Surcharge per 5/4/16 court order.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge

**Pursuant to the Court of Appeal decision in State v. Edward, 2015 WI 51, 363 Wis.2d 628 and State v. Radaj, 2015 WI 50, 363 Wis.2d 633, and 973.13, Stats., the JOC is amended to remove the DNA surcharge(s).  Government entities shall, to the extent legally obligated to do so, comply with the courts Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction Re: DNA Surcharge(s) entered herein.**

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all treatment recommendations; the Court indicates that the Agent may choose to accept the June 2014 assessment as compliance with this condition 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing; to occur at least once per month for the first six months of the Probation term
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, and except for incidental contact for employment or educational purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

Arresting Agency:FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF127 and #14CM153 called at 10:36am. 
Defendant Bryan J Shaughnessy in court with Attorney Brian Severson.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The State files an Amended Information in case #14CF127; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.   

Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered in Case #14CF127 and in Case #14CM153; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On both Case #14CF127 and Case #14CM153, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Shaughnessy on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all treatment recommendations; the Court indicates that the Agent may choose to accept the June 2014 assessment as compliance with this condition 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing; to occur at least once per month for the first six months of the Probation term
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, and except for incidental contact for employment or educational purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge in Case #14CF127
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge in Case #14CM153


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court indicates that if the DNA surcharge is found to be unconstitutional, and the Defendant has not yet paid the surcharge, then the Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to remove the surcharge payment requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.
recess 10:50am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF127 and #14CM153 called at 8:37am. 
Defendant Bryan J Shaughnessy in court with Attorney Brian Severson.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Severson indicates that Mr. Shaughnessy has completed an assessment and this has been provided to the State;  ADA beck is going to review the assessment information and then counsel plan to try to reach an agreement on the length of the recommended Probation term. 
Mr. Shaughnessy verifies that the Rangita Street address remains current.
recess 8:38am. 

NEXT:  schedule both cases for Plea/Sentencing within approximately thirty days
States demand w/cover letter
Status conference on August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 30, 2014 at 09:20 am.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF127 and #14CM153 called at 8:41am.
Defendant Bryan J Shaughnessy in court with Attorney Brian Severson.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In case #14CF127,  Mr. Shaughnessy waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
In case #14CF127, Arraignment is conducted: service of Information admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. A plea of "not guilty" is entered.

Attorney Severson explains that a condition of the pending plea agreement is that Mr. Shaughnessy undergo treatment. He has an appointment scheduled for an assessment next week.  
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess 8:45am.

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/30/14 at 9:20am. (2) schedule both cases for Status Conference approximately two weeks after the Pretrial date
Stipulation and Order to reschedule the 5/27/14 Preliminary Hearing
Waiver of Prelim on June 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Stipulation and Proposed Order to recshedule the 5/27/14 Preliminary Hearing
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 7, 2014 at 10:20 am.
Attorney Severson
Defendants demand
The defendant has retained Attorney Brian Severson
This bond applies to both case #14CF127 & #14CM153.

cases #13CM471,14CF127,#14CM153 called at 11:19am. 
Defendant Bryan J Shaughnessy in court with Attorneys Elizabeth F Svehlek and Attorney Brian Severson.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court signs the Stipulation & Order for Substitution of Defense counsel. 
Attorney Svehlek is excused and she exits the hearing at 11:20am. 

The Court conducts Initial Appearances in cases #14CF127 & #14CM153:
Service of each Criminal Complaint admitted, readings waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
In Case #14CF127, Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
in Case #14CM153, a plea of "not guilty" is entered

The Court requires a $2,000 Signature Bond (applies to both cases) , with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
--no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no direct or indirect contact with Joshua Wiggin or Bruce Waller
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking 

On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses case #13CM471.

Mr. Shaughnessy indicates that the Rangita Street address remains current. 
recess 11:26am. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/7/14 at 10:20am   (2) schedule case #14CF127 for Preliminary Hearing and case #14CM153 for Status Conference after the Pretrial date
Defendant's
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
